tooltip.itemwire.info.insulated: Does not shock you for V <= 240.0V
tooltip.itemwire.info.highlyinsulated: Does not shock you for V <= 960.0V
tooltip.itemwire.info.ceramic: Does not shock you for V <= 480.0V
tooltip.info.capacityupgrade: Multiplies Energy Capacity and Transfer by %sx
tooltip.info.capacityupgradevoltage: Will upgrade machine voltage up to %s
info.jei.item.compositearmor: This heavy-duty suit of armor allows the player to survive explosions. However, the player must be wearing a full set and must have Ceramic Plates added to the Body Armor. To add a Ceramic Plate, hold some in your main hand, have the Body Armor equiped to your Chestplate slot, and Right-Click. The Chestplate can hold a maximum of 2 at any given time.
info.jei.item.upgradeiteminput: The Auto-Injector Upgrade is an automation enthusiast's best friend. The item will input items from adjacent inventories based upon the directions specified. The device features two modes: Default and Smart. In default mode, the item will attempt to fill all input slots based upon the order of directions specified by it. Repeats of directions will have no effect. In Smart mode, each input slot is mapped to a direction in order. For example, say a machine has 2 input slots, and the directions specified on the upgrade are "North" and "South" (in that order). Slot 1 will be filled from the inventory to the relative North of the machine, and slot 2 will be filled from the relative South of the machine. You can have repeats of directions e.g. "North" "North".
info.jei.item.upgradeitemoutput: The Auto-Ejector Upgrade is an automation enthusiast's best friend. The item will output items to adjacent inventories based upon the directions specified. The device features two modes: Default and Smart. In default mode, the item will attempt to empty all output slots (including biproduct slots) based upon the order of directions specified by it. Repeats of directions will have no effect. In Smart mode, each output slot (including biproduct slots) is mapped to a direction in order. For example, say a machine has 1 output slot and 1 biproduct slot, and the directions specified on the upgrade are "North" and "South" (in that order). The output slot will be emptied to the inventory to the relative North of the machine, and the biproduct slot will be emptied to the relative South of the machine. You can have repeats of directions e.g. "North" "North".
